ygData.subject: Impressively Smart, Non-Evolved Neural Network
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello all, At GECCO there were a few different conversations about whether neuroevolution remains a promising path to AI given the progress being made in other

Subject: Impressively Smart, Non-Evolved Neural Network
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=464818732; y=3EkjziJOYzRcPBKlg5IRsAGKlfakTGZvMn5oiF4ykXaRiZ2lvp7b

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=us-ascii

Hello all,

At GECCO there were a few different conversations about whether=
 neuroevolution remains a promising path to AI given the progress being mad=
e in other AI/neural network areas relative to the progress in neuroevoluti=
on. One issue mentioned a few times was this recent paper that shows surpri=
singly impressive AI in a non-evolved neural network. 	

http://clm.utexas.=
edu/compjclub/papers/Eliasmith2012.pdf

Many people on this list expressed =
an interest in reading this paper and discussing its techniques and implica=
tions on the NEAT list. 

I don't understand their learning mechanisms (bec=
ause I have not taken the time to read the papers they reference), but if s=
omeone does get a good grasp on how the magic happens, please share your ta=
ke. More generally, I'd be interested in any of your reactions regarding wh=
ether you agree that this  is a very impressive level of intelligence (and =
well beyond what we can currently evolve) and whether that means we should =
question our devotion to neuroevolution as one of the quickest paths to AGI=
. I want to note that I'm not (yet!) taking a position, but am just curious=
 to hear what you think. 

Let the discussion begin!


Best regards,
Jeff C=
lune

Assistant Professor
Computer Science
University of Wyoming
jeffclune@=
uwyo.edu
jeffclune.com


--Apple-Mail=_B0AA3D5D-8F5A-439B-BECD-48419D535CD2
